[[Cleopatra Records]] | website = {{official website|http://www.lglmusic.com/}} }} '''Linda Gail Lewis''' (born July 18, 1947) is an American singer, songwriter and pianist. She has recorded with her brother [[Jerry Lee Lewis]], as well as [[Van Morrison]], [[Robbie Fulks]], [[Wanda Jackson]], [[Melanie (singer)|Melanie]], [[Dale Watson (singer)|Dale Watson]], [[Mitch Ryder]] and [[Robert Gordon (singer)|Robert Gordon]]. She also has recorded with her two daughters, Mary Jean Ferguson and Annie Marie Lewis, in a group called the Lewis 3. Since 2019 she has been signed with [[Cleopatra Records]] and most her albums have been produced by her son-in-law [[Danny B. Harvey]], guitarist with [[The Rockats]], [[Lemmy|Lemmy Kilmister]] and [[The Head Cat|The Headcat]] along with drummer [[Slim Jim Phantom]] from [[Stray Cats]] and [[The Head Cat|The Headcat]]. [[Clem Burke]] from [[Blondie (band)|Blondie]] is the drummer on her latest single. {{Cite web |title=Lewis (and her daughters) make beautiful music (occasionally) and carry on the legacy – March 2020|url=https://www.countrystandardtime.com/d/article.asp?xid=1235 |access-date=2023-04-19 |website=www.countrystandardtime.com}} She is married to former Stax promotions director Eddie Braddock. ==Discography== ===Albums=== {| class="wikitable" !
